title.narrative: Small Grant Initiatives for Climate Adaptation Projects in Indonesia (ACCCRN)

description.narrative: The early adopter cities are expected to implement tangible actions that contribute to city-level resilience building and demonstrate city stakeholders’ commitment to UCCR, such as cross-institutional coordination, sharing experiences and learning, and triggering budget allocations for adaptation actions.

The goal of the Small Grants Initiatives program is to enable ACCCRN early adopter cities to test their strategies for adaptation to climate change and urban resilience through small grant pilot projects. The projects will provide cities with evidence necessary to leverage resources, and incentivize and trigger the application of city resilience strategies in their entirety. They will also provide city teams with the opportunity to gain hands-on experience with resilience projects and deepen their understanding of urban climate change resilience.
The types of projects funded by this initiative include, but are not restricted to (examples are projects that have already been completed or implemented in two ACCCRN Indonesia core cities): 1. A study that informs project application, i.e. preliminary assessment of rainwater harvesting or groundwater conservation through biopore infiltration holes 2. Adaptation actions such as coastal area conservation through mangrove reforestation, flood preparedness, etc. 3. Capacity building and awareness campaigns, such as climate change modules for school children, dengue fever awareness campaign or health early warning systems
